item.title: Docker Compose File for WordPress & MariaDB
item.description:
After some frustrating attempts to create a working Docker configuration for a WordPress system, I have finally found a working solution. It uses the default WordPress Docker image and MariaDB.

This is a minimal configuration, you may also want to specify a data volume for persistence.

# docker-compose.yml file for a minimal working WordPress instance with separate database<br /> version: '2'<br /> services:<br />  wordpress:<br />   image: wordpress<br />   links:<br />   - wordpress_db:mysql<br />   ports:<br />   - 8090:80<br />   environment:<br />    WORDPRESS_DB_HOST: wordpress_db:3306<br />    WORDPRESS_DB_PASSWORD: password<br />  wordpress_db:<br />   image: mariadb<br />   environment:<br />    MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: password<br />
